trans-unit.source: Base class that represents an email attachment.
Classes <xref href="System.Net.Mail.Attachment"></xref>, <xref href="System.Net.Mail.AlternateView"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Net.Mail.LinkedResource"></xref> derive from this class.
Instantiates an <xref href="System.Net.Mail.AttachmentBase"></xref> with the specified <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
A stream containing the content for this attachment.
contentStream is `null`.
Instantiates an <xref href="System.Net.Mail.AttachmentBase"></xref> with the specified file name.
The file name holding the content for this attachment.
fileName is `null`.
Instantiates an <xref href="System.Net.Mail.AttachmentBase"></xref> with the specified <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> and <xref href="System.Net.Mime.ContentType"></xref>.
A stream containing the content for this attachment.
The type of the content.
contentStream is `null`.
contentType is not a valid value.
Instantiates an <xref href="System.Net.Mail.AttachmentBase"></xref> with the specified <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> and media type.
A stream containing the content for this attachment.
The MIME media type of the content.
contentStream is `null`.
mediaType is not a valid value.
Instantiates an <xref href="System.Net.Mail.AttachmentBase"></xref> with the specified file name and content type.
The file name holding the content for this attachment.
The type of the content.
fileName is `null`.
contentType is not a valid value.
Instantiates an <xref href="System.Net.Mail.AttachmentBase"></xref> with the specified file name and media type.
The file name holding the content for this attachment.
The MIME media type of the content.
fileName is `null`.
mediaType is not a valid value.
Gets or sets the MIME content ID for this attachment.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> holding the content ID.
Attempted to set <xref href="System.Net.Mail.AttachmentBase.ContentId"></xref> to `null`.
Gets the content stream of this attachment.
A <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref>.
The content stream of this attachment.
Gets the content type of this attachment.
A <xref href="System.Net.Mime.ContentType"></xref>.
The content type for this attachment.
Releases the resources used by the <xref href="System.Net.Mail.AttachmentBase"></xref>.
Call <xref:System.Net.Mail.AttachmentBase.Dispose%2A> when you are finished using the <xref:System.Net.Mail.AttachmentBase>.
The <xref:System.Net.Mail.AttachmentBase.Dispose%2A> method leaves the <xref:System.Net.Mail.AttachmentBase> in an unusable state.

After calling <xref:System.Net.Mail.AttachmentBase.Dispose%2A>, you must release all references to the <xref:System.Net.Mail.AttachmentBase> so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the <xref:System.Net.Mail.AttachmentBase> was occupying.

For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).
**Note** Always call <xref:System.Net.Mail.AttachmentBase.Dispose%2A> before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.Net.Mail.AttachmentBase>.
Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the <xref:System.Net.Mail.AttachmentBase> object's `Finalize` method.
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the <xref href="System.Net.Mail.AttachmentBase"></xref> and optionally releases the managed resources.
This method is called by the public `Dispose()` method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method.
`Dispose()` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`.
<xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`.
When the `disposing` parameter is true, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.Net.Mail.AttachmentBase> references.
This method invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object.
`true` to release both managed and unmanaged resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
Gets or sets the encoding of this attachment.
A <xref href="System.Net.Mime.TransferEncoding"></xref>.
The encoding for this attachment.
